verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on a stringed instrument. A Psalm of David. Hear<WH8085> my cry<WH7440>, O God<WH430>; Attend<WH7181> unto my prayer<WH8605>.
From the end<WH7097> of the earth<WH776> will I call<WH7121> unto thee<WH3820>, when my heart is overwhelmed<WH5848>: Lead<WH5148> me to the rock<WH6697> that is higher than I<WH7311>.
For thou hast been a refuge<WH4268> for me<WH5797>, A strong tower<WH4026> from<WH6440> the enemy<WH341>.
I will dwell<WH1481> in thy tabernacle<WH168> for ever<WH5769>: I will take refuge<WH2620> in the covert<WH5643> of thy wings<WH3671>. <WH5542>[[Selah
For thou<WH430>, O God, hast heard<WH8085> my vows<WH5088>: Thou hast given<WH5414> me the heritage<WH3425> of those that fear<WH3373> thy name<WH8034>.
Thou wilt prolong<WH3254> the king<WH4428>'s life<WH3117>; His years<WH8141> shall be as many<WH1755> generations<WH1755>.
He shall abide<WH3427> before<WH6440> God<WH430> for ever<WH5769>: Oh prepare<WH4487> lovingkindness<WH2617> and truth<WH571>, that they may preserve him<WH5341>.
So will I sing<WH2167> praise unto thy name<WH8034> for ever<WH5703>, That I may daily<WH3117> perform<WH7999> my vows<WH5088>.
